intro: Guagnebina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers and velvety foliage. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and clustered leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Guagnebina thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
